Sync="TRUE">0</attwidth></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">FLAG</attrlabl><attrdef>Used to indicate areas with special rules that are not mappable.  0 indicates no special rules.  1 indicates a hunt area or portion of a hunt area that may not be accurately mapped such as weapon closures or hunting within one mile of cultivated agriculture fields only.  See regulations for details.</attrdef><attalias Sync="TRUE">FLAG</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">18</atprecis><attscale IDFG</edomvds></edom><edom><edomv>11</edomv><edomvd>California Bighorn Sheep</edomvd><edomvds>pbond, IDFG</edomvds></edom><edom><edomv>13</edomv><edomvd>Turkey</edomvd><edomvds>pbond, Sync="TRUE">10</attwidth><attrdef>Numeric value (rank) given to hunting area based on the lowest numeric GMU it is in.</attrdef><atprecis Sync="TRUE">10</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdefs>bthomas, idfg</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">AreaID</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">AreaID</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">10</attwidth><attrdef>Unique Identifier of the hunt area in the Hunting Regulations database.</attrdef><atprecis Sync="TRUE">10</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdefs>bthomas, idfg</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">AreaNote</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">AreaNote</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">254</attwidth><attrdef>Full description of the Hunt Area as found in the IDFG hunting regulations, concatenated at 255 characters.</attrdef><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdefs>bthomas, idfg</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">HuntArea</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">HuntArea</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">100</attwidth><attrdef>Hunt Area Number from current printed regulations. Hunt areas followed by an asterisk (*) include other units, parts of other units, or only a portion of the unit.</attrdef><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdefs>bthomas, idfg</attrdefs></attr></detailed><overview xmlns=""><eaover>The following layers were used to digitize hunt area boundaries:  1) State Outline, IDFG's state.shp, a modified version of the Inside Idaho coverage with streams_measured (100k) used for improved hydrography boundaries. NOTE: This boundary file used to clip the 24K GMUs is NOT 24k but 100k in resolution, at time of publishing no official 24k state boundary was available.  2) County Boundaries from DRG's or where coincident with streams from streams, divides from IDWR Prelim Divides or digitized from DRGs  3) Roads a. ITD Roads, itd.shp b. National Forest Roads: Boise, Salmon/Challis, Clearwater, Nez Perce c. BLM Roads d. Ada County Roads e. USGS DLG Roads (using GDT and TIGER to determine road names) f. GDT Roads - new construction not represented in other files only g. Digitized from DOQ where not available in any layer (< 5 cases)  4)Hydrography based on National Hydrography Dataset or digitized from DRGs Note: In all cases where islands are included/excluded from a Unit the appropriate shoreline was used to represent the boundary rather than stream centerline. In case of CJ Strike, the body of water representing the Snake River was used, portion of reservoir attributed to the Bruneau River was excluded.  5) Divides from IDWR Preliminary New 24k HUC file or digitized from DRGs  6) Utility Lines and Fences digitized from DRGs/DOQs  7) Physical Features such as peaks, passes, rocks and the like from GNIS/DRGs  8) National Wildlife Refuge Boundaries from the IDFG Conservation Data Center (CDC)</eaover></overview></eainfo><distinfo><distrib><cntinfo><cntpos>GIS Analyst</cntpos><cntaddr><addrtype>mailing and physical address</addrtype><address>600 South Walnut, P.O.
